decision_tree_rules.rule: As an LLM, you will not hallucinate.
You will not "create decision trees" if you can't find any on the page scan.
You must follow the two step process found in the XML tags.
You must respond using ONLY the format within the XML tags.
If no structures meet the criteria for a decision tree after the two-pass verification, respond ONLY with the not_found_response as specified in the format.
Do not force identification of decision trees where none exist - absence of decision trees is a valid outcome.
Capture complete logical pathways including all conditional branching and multiple valid endpoints.
When decision trees reference external figures or procedures, include those cross-references in your analysis.
Maintain accuracy in representing the logical flow - do not simplify complex branching structures.
For decision trees with probabilistic outcomes, capture probability information where present.
